parameters.definition: Processing capacity of the high intensity drill per day
Water usage of the high intensity drill per day
Processing capacity of the low intensity drill per day
Water usage of the low intensity drill per day
Total number of gems that must be processed each day
Total amount of water available each day
Maximum percentage of high intensity drills
Minimum number of low intensity drills required

description: A gem factory has two drills, a high intensity one and a low intensity one. Each day, the high intensity drill can process \param{CapHigh} gems and requires \param{WaterHigh} units of water to dissipate heat. Each day, the low intensity drill can process \param{CapLow} gems and requires \param{WaterLow} units of water to dissipate heat. Each day the factory must process \param{TotalGems} gems and they have available \param{TotalWater} units of water. Since the high intensity drill produces a lot of noise pollution, at most \param{MaxPercentHigh} of the drills can be high intensity ones. Further, at least \param{MinLowDrills} should be low intensity drills. How many of each drill should be used to minimize the total number of drills needed?
